result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner L. Kroening was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances. 

No driving without valid driver's license.

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample. 

Court will grant expungement on felony charge upon successful completion of probation.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Case Called: 10:11 am
INCLUDES 21CF567, 22CF777, 21CF667, 21CF923.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person:
Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty John Mathie in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
22CF777:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 >> Delete the 'Repeater' Enhancer. 

21CF567:
Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>> State moves to Revoke the DEOJ Agreement- Defense is in agreement to DEOJ being revoked. COURT Grant's the State's Motion to Revoke the DEOJ Agreement and Judgment is to be entered. 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
22CF777:
Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (OWI 2nd)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Atty Mathie is requesting expungement on the Felony convictions. 
ADA Brubacher makes statements. 
Court to address expungement at the time of sentencing. 

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF777:
Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 4 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, No Driving without a Valid License, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 54 Days Credit. Court will grant Expungement on the Felony charges upon successful completion of the Probation sentence. 

Ct. 3 (OWI 2nd)>> $1,429 Fine inclusive, DNA Sample. 5 Days MCJ w/Huber/EMP privileges. Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 12 Months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 Price IID installation fee to be paid; 12 Month dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office. Court finds 5 Days Credit. 

21CF567:
Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>> Sentence W/H- 4 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, No Driving without a Valid License, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 54 Days Credit. Court will grant Expungement on the Felony charges upon successful completion of the Probation sentence. 

Sentencing Hearing on Revocation:
21CF567:
Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>> 30 Days MCJ. Any outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. Court finds 54 Days Credit. 

21CF667:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>> 30 Days MCJ, Consecutive to Jail sentence on Count 3 in 21CF567.Any outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. Court finds 54 Days Credit. 

21CF923:
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>> 30 Days MCJ, Concurrent to other jail sentences. Any outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. Court finds 54 Days Credit.
